thread.title: Court reverses Sheriff Dixon case ruling
thread.title_full: Court reverses Sheriff Dixon case ruling

title: Court reverses Sheriff Dixon case ruling
text:
Court reverses Sheriff Dixon case ruling Cole County judge says Dixon did not receive fair trial Tweet JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. - 
In a ruling by Cole County Judge Jon Beetem Thursday night, the Missouri Department of Public Safety's decision to revoke Osage County Sheriff Michael Dixon's peace officer license is reversed. Related Content Possible scam targeting Verizon customers 
The 28-page ruling from Judge Beetem says Sheriff Dixon did not receive a fair trial. The judge cited several irregularities including DPS's releasing a statement to the news media about the sheriff's revocation before the sheriff had even received the final opinion. 
Judge Beetem reversed the Department of Public Safety's decision and ordered the Administrative Hearing Commission to rehear the case for a "cause" determination. 
Join ABC 17 News at 9 & 10 for reaction from Sheriff Dixon. Recommended
